The third-level U.S. government organization name related to the organization reported in the government interest statement on patents (if available). For example, the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health is third-level in relation to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention that report to the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

The second-level U.S. government organization name related to the organization reported in the government interest statement on patents (if available). For example, the National Institutes of Health is second-level in relation to the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute.
The full government interest statement as reported on a given patent (if available).
Name of the U.S. government organization reported in the government interest statement on patents (if available).
Contract or award number as reported in the government interest statement on patents (if available)
Organization ID of the U.S. government agency reported in the government interest statement on patents (if available)

The top-level U.S. government organization name related to the organization reported in the government interest statement on patents (if available). For example, the National Institutes of Health report to the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.
